fields.description: The Parent link field behaves similarly to the Epic link field, it lists issues from all the projects that the user has permission to browse, it could be helpful to have a way to restrict the listed issues to for example only issues from the same project.
fields.summary: The "Parent Link" field list issues from all the projects instead of the current one

fields.description: As a user, it would be nice to receive a clearer message when request header exceeds the limit in Jira.
fields.summary: Improve error message for HTTP Status 400 – Bad Request - Message Request header is too large

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion:

Create an action that uses the Outlook/Gmail Rest API to create an event for a specified list of users.
fields.summary: Automation for Jira: Action to Create Outlook/Gmail Calendar event

fields.description:
{quote}As a new issue viewing customer

I want to pin the Automation rules field

So after a screen refresh I don't need to scroll down each time to access the rules
{quote}
 

Acceptance criteria:
 * On the new issue view, I can pin the Automation field in the view
 * When the Automation field is pinned, the Recent Rule Executions section does not display on the view
fields.summary: ability to pin Automation rules field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a Custom Field (In this case a Multiple Choice DropDown field) has a value that contains German Eszett "ß" For Eg: ‘Straße’. The JQL fails to search the value and the following error is shown --> "*The option ‘Straße’ for field ‘Multiple Choice DropDown[Select List (multiple choices)]’ does not exist.*"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Multiple Choice DropDown Field.
 # Add some values to the field and include the following Value ‘Straße’
 # Add it to an Issue Screen.
 # Open the JQL Issue Navigator Page.
 # Select the Project and filter the Multiple Choice Dropdown field and Select the Value that has German Eszett "ß" in it. Click {color:#4c9aff}Search{color}

h3. Expected Results

Search and List the Issues that contain the Value ‘Straße’ in the Multiple Choice Dropdown Field.
h3. Actual Results

Error:
{code:java}
*The option ‘Straße’ for field ‘Multiple Choice DropDown[Select List (multiple choices)]’ does not exist.*
{code}
Even though the Value is added to the field.
!image-2021-04-09-21-12-06-562.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Change the value in the custom field to contain "ss" instead of "ß" and do searches also with "ss instead of ß"

*NOTE:* ‘Straße’ can be denoted as ‘Strasse’. "ß" is often transliterated as “ss”.
fields.summary: Searching in JQL for a value in the Custom Field that contains German Eszett "ß" results in Error: The option <Value> for field <FieldType> does not exist.

fields.description: I would love to be able to find an issue in teams integration and say start ECHO-1234 or whatever and then stop ECHO-1234 and then it add the hours to the item.  If I start another issue, it should act like stop on any started issue and then start that lime on the new one.
fields.summary: Teams Integration-add start and stop commands

fields.description:
The context column takes about 40% of the whole Jira issue screen. This is way too wide and forces hours and hours of text formatting workarounds upon us in order to be able to see the whole ticket content at once.
 * Almost 50 % of the context column is unused.
 * Viewers cannot decide whether they want to see the context column and the ticket content or just the ticket content or cannot adjust the widths of these. 

*My suggestion*

In coherence with the left column, make it possible to adjust the width or collapse. collapse.

!image-2021-04-09-07-45-44-353.png!
fields.summary: Ability to adjust the Context Column width

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a Classic Software Project using the *Share settings with an existing project* of another Classic Software Project that does not have a Board, the Project sidebar becomes inaccessible.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Classic Software Project (PKEY1) and delete its Board, making it "boardless"
# Create a second Classic Project (PKEY2) using *Share settings with an existing project* with that same project
# You will land on the issues page, click on *Back to project* to try to see the Project sidebar

h3. Expected Results

Clicking on *Back to project* should switch to the project sidebar and display other options such as Project settings, Project pages, Components, ect...

h3. Actual Results

The page reloads and you will remain on the issues view, never getting to see the Project sidebar.

 !2021-04-01_16-06-45.gif|width=400&height=200!

h3. Workaround

This mainly happens when clicking attempting to access the Project sidebar too soon after loading the page. If you wait an extra 15 seconds (or until your browser indicates the page is fully loaded) and then click on *Back to project* this will open the Project sidebar.
fields.summary: Can't access project sidebar when created without a Board

fields.description:
A current JIRA Core business projects does not display the Project pages to add confluence space/pages, the icon is not listed in the project menu.

_At current Project Pages is only listed in the software project templates._

Yes, users can add a link item but that’s not going to provide all the great features, that is available with Project pages.

Recommended, to be added to project settings, or standard project menu link.
fields.summary: JIRA Core Business Project - Project Pages Icon in project menu

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When changing the Reporter and custom user picker fields, unknown users to JS is available in the dropdown when editing these fields in JS. These users belong to JSM and does not have any access to JS application.


h3. Environment
JS
.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a custom user-picker field- Eg:Approvers.
2. Add a user to JSM ( test@123.com)
3. Create a case in a project with the above fields added.
4. While editing these fields, you will see users in JSM available in the dropdown and issues can be assigned to them.


h3. Expected Results
JSM users must not come up in the dropdown for Reporter and custom user-picker field if they don't have access to JS.

h3. Actual Results
JSM users are shown and available to JS under Reporter and custom user picker field.

h3. Workaround
_(Add a workaround, if available)_

h3. Notes
fields.summary: JSM portal users are listed under dropdown for Reporter and custom user picker fields in JS

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When attempting to edit issues within Filter Results gadget it hangs

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# In any dashboard add gadget Filter Results and have it configured to show any issues accordingly (the problem happens regardless of the filter configuration);
# Hover the upper right line of any issue within the gadget and select (…) - Edit - !Screen Shot 2021-04-08 at 17.08.38.png|thumbnail!;

h3. Expected Results

We should be prompt to editing the issue;

h3. Actual Results

The interface hangs with no error whatsoever

!result.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cannot Edit Issues within Jira’s Filter Results Gadget

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using CTRL/CMD + click to open issues from a Dashboard gadget in a new browser tab will open the issue in the same tab.

This started happening recently.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a dashboard with gadgets that list issues.
# Use CTRL/CMD + left mouse click to open the issue URL link in a new browser tab

*In testing the behavior was initially correct but adding a new gadget in the dashboard caused the problem to appear.

h3. Expected Results

The issue should open in a new browser tab to allow the users to keep working on the dashboard.

h3. Actual Results

The issue is opened in the same browser tab where the dashboard was opened causing the dashboard to disappear.

h3. Workaround

Using the secondary click on the mouse and selecting the option to open the link in a new tab is still available
fields.summary: Using CTRL/CMD + click to open issues from a Dashboard gadget in a new browser tab will open the issue in the same tab

fields.description: When adding a Parent link a list of suggestions is displayed but if you start typing an issue key it is not showing until the complete issue key is written, this is not practical when there are a lot of options to select and would be helpful that when you start typing the issue key suggestions are displayed.
fields.summary: When start typing an issue in the Parent link field nothing is returned until the complete issue is written

fields.description:
Presently, the epics progress bar – portraying the Done issues – is only seen within an Epic when you open it up.
 * It would be helpful if this detail is also seen in the Issue Search page, to give a better and faster overview for the epics from that page itself.

Currently, we only see a Progress bar in the issue search, but that is *only* for time tracking details. 
 !TimeTracking Progress Bar.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow Epic's progress bar information to be seen from the Issue Search page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the old issue view, in the attachments section, when you hovered with the mouse over an attachment icon it showed among the other things the name of the user that uploaded the attachment:
 !old-issue-view-attachment-mouse-hover.jpg|thumbnail! 

In the new issue view only the file name shown on mouse hover and this is fairly useless as the file name is already shown in the list.


For further details see:
* https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Core-questions/New-issue-view-attachment-missing-person-details/qaq-p/1653314
fields.summary: The name of the uploader is not shown when hovering the mouse on the files in the attachment panel of the new issue view

fields.description:
Currently, when configuring a rule for checking {{User Condition}} to confirm whether a user belongs to a project role or otherwise, it *also* checks the default membership for that role.

Automation for Jira should allow a choice on the scope of where to check the user's membership.
{quote}It would be the best to give choice what to check: project level membership for the role, or default membership for the role, or both.
{quote}
fields.summary: Allow User Condition to check the project role membership within the project only

fields.description: h3. Problem Definition In some cases, there is a need to add HTML links to issue fields via clipboard that is not supported in the new issue view.  Example: Some Link h3. Suggestion Allow HTML Hyperlinks copied from clipboard to be rendered in the new issue view along with *[Markdown format|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/markdown-and-keyboard-shortcuts/]* for the new View.
fields.summary: Support adding HTML links to issue fields in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem : In a NextGen Project, restrictions do not apply when an issue is created within backlog / board.
h3. Steps to Reproduce :

1. Select a NextGen Project. Navigate to Project settings>>Issue Types and set restrictions to an issuetype as shown below :

!image-2021-03-26-05-54-11-880.png|width=193,height=100!

 

2. Create an issue from the Project as shown below :
 !image-2021-03-26-05-57-57-475.png|width=208,height=209!

3. Issue created from Project shows the restrictions applied :

!image-2021-03-26-06-03-00-146.png|width=462,height=83!

4. Now create an issue from the Backlog/board as shown below :

!image-2021-03-26-06-10-35-269.png|width=180,height=97!
h3. Expected Results

_Restriction should apply for issues created from backlog/board_
h3. Actual Results

_Issues created from backlog/board do not show restrictions._

_!image-2021-03-26-06-24-51-548.png|width=399,height=43!_

_!image-2021-03-26-06-27-15-124.png|width=519,height=46!_
h3. Suggestion

Apply restrictions to issues created inline from backlog/board and provide warning that restrictions are applied and user may not be able to view issue depending on their permissions
h3. Notes

Please see following documentation regarding restricting issues [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/create-an-issue-and-a-sub-task/]
fields.summary: Restrictions do not apply when an issue is created within backlog / board
Consistent APIs for option fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When changing date fields of an issue, the history will show an entry D-1 on the new issue view instead of the correct date, as in the old issue view:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make a change in any date fields and save it.

h3. Expected Results

Date fields on the issue and history shows the same date.
h3. Actual Results

D-1 date shown on history when seeing through new issue view:

!image-2021-04-07-16-34-56-082.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Use the old issue view.
fields.summary: Changes made on date fields shows date as D-1 on history of the New Issue View

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to be able to use Automation for Jira to sum the story points of the issues within a Sprint.
Currently, we can only see the Sum of Story Points at the Reports or at the Board Backlog, but the Sum cannot be accessed anywhere.

As a user, I'd like to be able to access the Sum of the Story Points of the issues from a given Sprint and store them into a custom field.

In order to do that, it would be awesome if Automation could handle that using smart values and a branch to go over all the issues into a given Sprint and sum the Story point value into a variable.

Currently, it is possible to only sum the story points from the sub-task into the parent issue.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to use Automation for Jira to sum the story points of the issues within a Sprint
Requesting a notification scheme through the REST API with UserCustomField or GroupCustomField notification does not return an identity
Requesting a notification scheme through the REST API with user notification returns "unknown"

fields.description: When exporting via CSV, the sub-tasks should be present under parents by defualt. The sub-tasks without a parent in the JQL search should be listed separately at the end.
fields.summary: Sub-tasks should be listed under parent tasks in CSV export

fields.description: Currently, alphabets like "y" and "p" alphabets are not displaying properly in the filter title. The line height of h1 containing filter title is not accomodating alphabets like 'p' and 'y' causing it to get trimmed.
fields.summary: Alphabets like y and p are not displaying properly in filter title

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
JQL "status was <status name> on <yyyy/MM/dd>" does not fetch correct results

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Search for issues that were on a particular status on a certain date range using the following JQL: 
 {code}status was "In Progress" on "2021/02/02"{code}

h3. Expected Results
Issues that were in "In Progress" status on "2021/02/02" should be fetched. 

h3. Actual Results
Issues that were in "In Progress" in 2019 are also fetched with this query. 
 
h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JQL "status was <status name> on <yyyy/MM/dd>" does not fetch correct results

fields.description: ability to create a pie chart in dashboards to display how many projects each project lead has. Each segment in the pie chart would represent a % of the total
fields.summary: dashboard to monitor % of projects each project lead has

fields.description:
In the workflow steps (e.g. status Open) the workflow step property key "jira.permission.create" has no effect.

Restricting the creation to a group does not work. The users of the restricted group are still able to create issues.
fields.summary: Workflow step property jira.permission.create has no effect

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

To be able to bulk move/copy users from group to User Picker (multiple users) custom field.
h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to allow users to be able to bulk move/copy users from group to custom field.

This would allow admin to manage those members in one place and it will be used in many projects in the future.
fields.summary: Ability to copy group members to custom field (user picker field)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Improve error message when inviting users fails due to license limit reached. This will then allow users to self-service and correct the issue without having to contact support:

There has been https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-71719 previously however it has not fully addressed this issue.
h3.  

*Scenario 1:*
 !Screenshot at Apr 07 11-58-20 (1).png|width=333,height=123!
 Steps to Reproduce
 # Be at your max user limit e.g. 10/10 on standard plan
 # Invite someone 

h3. Expected Results

Error message stating why you cannot invite the user at Step 2.
h3. Actual Results

X Invite not sent
 We couldn't invite <email>
 Contact support

Console error shown:
{noformat}
{"errorMessages":["LICENSE_LIMIT_REACHED"],"errors":}
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

None. The error directs users to contact support.

*Scenario 2:*
 !image-2021-06-24-15-20-27-512.png|width=250,height=106!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add default access group for the *StatusPage* and be at the max user limit
 # Invite someone 

h3. Expected Results

Error message stating for which product you have reached the maximum number of user
h3. Actual Results

You would receive the error "You've reached the maximum number of users for one of your products.".
 It should clearly mention for which project the license count has reached the maximum limit.
h3. Workaround

Check the license count for every product manually.
fields.summary: Improve error message when inviting users fails due to license limit reached

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Epic icon is not properly displayed when searching for issues inside a project.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to a Jira software project > Issues:
!Screen Shot 2021-04-06 at 20.43.46.png|width=129,height=225!
 # Click on the "type" button at the search to select an issue type and check that the Epic is not properly displayed with the correct purple icon displayed in other views:
!Screen Shot 2021-04-06 at 20.45.41.png|width=236,height=138!!Screen Shot 2021-04-06 at 20.47.34.png|width=281,height=100!

h3. Expected Results

The purple icon displayed in other views is not displayed.
h3. Actual Results

A grey icon is displayed.
h3. Workaround

None so far.
fields.summary: Epic icon not properly displayed in issue search inside a project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users would benefit from having the Epic name in the *Epic Link* field when it is exported in CSV or Excel files as currently only the Issue Key is exported as a hyperlink.

In Jira issue search the field is displayed as the Epic name that links to the Epic.

h3. Workaround

Using the HTML export displays the Epic link field as the name of the epic in plain text.
fields.summary: Ability to export the *Epic Link* as the Epic name instead of the Epic key in CSV/Excel files

fields.description:
Problem:

When viewing an initiative issue type (either in quick view or by navigating to the URL) it is only possible to see the epics linked beneath it or any subtasks that have been added to the issue itself. Ideally, it should be possible to access a single screen view of *all* the children (and children of children) linked below an initiative.

Suggested Solution:

Enable the full hierarchy of stories and tasks that sit beneath any linked epics to be visible from the initiative issue screen. Ideally, these stories and tasks would be grouped by each epic also.

Workaround:

We are currently unable to find a work around, the user must currently follow the hyperlink to any linked epics to see the stories and tasks below that.
fields.summary: See all associated epics, tasks, and stories from Initiative screen view

fields.description:
when using pullrequest, make a rule be triggered by a webhook, by including webhooks in the DevOps category: 
 !image-2021-04-06-16-30-08-655.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: include webhooks in DevOps triggers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a work log is inserted for an issue, the tab for Work log doesn't respect the user's timezone setting. Instead, it will display the time entry calculated as Sydney time.

For example:
# A work log of 4 hours was inserted at 15:52 (GMT-3)
# When we head to the work log tab using the New Issue View, we can see that even though it states that it was inserted 5 hours ago now, the exact time entry is displayed in Sydney's timezone:
 !image-2021-04-06-16-31-11-328.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insert a work log to an issue using the New Issue View
 # Check the work log tab of the respective issue

h3. Expected Results
Entry time should be calculated and displayed respecting user's timezone setting

h3. Actual Results
Entry time is displayed considering Sydney's timezone

h3. Workaround
Check the History tab instead which seems to be working or use the old issue view while still available.
fields.summary: Work log time entry doesn't respect user's timezone settings in the Work log tab of the New Issue View

fields.description: Add the availability to export the Calendar Gadget to MS Outlook
fields.summary: Export Calendar gadget to MS Outlook

fields.description: Please add the availability to include Forms and Calendar to Company-managed Software Projects
fields.summary: Include Forms and Calendar to Company-managed Software Projects
Give better feedback on API issue creation failures

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the Jira new issue view, Story points custom field can be viewed and edited even though the field has been removed from the View and Edit screens associated with the issue type.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a Jira project with Scrum template
2. Remove the Story Points custom field from the View and Edit screens
3. Try to view and edit the Story Points custom field in the jira issue

h3. Expected Results
The Story points field should no longer be visible/editable if the field has been removed from the View/Edit screens.

h3. Actual Results
The Story Points field is still seen in the issue view and is editable even though the field has been removed from the View and Edit screens.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Story Points custom field can be edited/viewed even though the field is removed from the Edit/View screens

fields.description: If a few users are editing and updating issues the 30-second auto-refresh causes the board to twitch and lose the column header (status name) for a short period of time.
fields.summary: Improve Kanban board refresh mechanism to reduce UI Jankiness ( Board Twitching)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A particular class of plugins has been identified for generating a large number of requests which leads to many requests failing.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Using certain plugins generates a high request load on Jira

h3. Expected Results

500 HTTP error response is never returned.
h3. Actual Results

500 HTTP responses are received over a sustained period of time. 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Using certain plugins which update issues intermittently results in 500 responses

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is not possible to move another (second) Jira issues Calendar gadget to the right-hand side of the dashboard if already have an existing Jira issues Calendar gadget at the top right-hand side of the dashboard
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new dashboard
 # Add multiple Jira issues Calendars gadget to the dashboard
 # Move one of the Jira issues Calendar gadgets to the top right-hand side of the dashboard
 # Try to move the second Jira issues Calendar gadgets under it

h3. Expected Results

To able to move the second Jira issues Calendar gadgets to the right-hand side of dashboard under the first Jira issues Calendar gadgets 
h3. Actual Results

It is not possible to move the second Jira issues Calendar gadgets to the right-hand side of the dashboard under the first Jira issues Calendar gadgets 

The same issue happening if try to move it back to the left-hand-side of the dashboard 

 

h3. Workaround

* Under the Jira issues Calendar gadgets on the right-hand side of the dashboard create an Assigned to Me gadget 
* Move the desire Jira issue Calendar gadget to the right-hand side of the dashboard 
* Move the Assigned to Me gadget to the left-hand side of the dashboard
* Move the Jira issue Calendar gadget to the left-hand side of the dashboard
* Delete the Assigned to Me gadget
fields.summary: It is not possible to move another (second) Jira issues Calendar gadget to the right-hand side of the dashboard if already have an existing Jira issues Calendar gadget at the top right-hand side of the dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Our Cloud products are not trusting server certificates issued by Sectigo for application links.

Sectigo is a privately held company that offers SSL certificate and computer security products. It was previously known as Comodo and Comodo CA but has since been sold to new owners and changed its name to Sectigo on November 1st, 2018.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try to create an applink with a server instance that uses a certificate issued by Sectigo.

h3. Expected Results
It should trust the certificate.

h3. Actual Results
The following error message is shown:
{quote}The remote certificate can't be trusted

Server JIRA may be using a self-signed SSL certificate or a certificate that was issued by a certificate authority that isn't known locally.{quote}

h3. Notes
Certificates from Comodo are accepted, as per https://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/technotes/tools/solaris/keytool.html#cacerts


h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cloud products are not trusting Certificates issued by Sectigo

fields.description:
Users have found an old jquery into metal-all.js, and the security scanner is complaining about it. It was identified that an out-of-date version of jQuery ( 1.7.2) has been used.

The request would be to remediate them as soon as possible.
fields.summary: Old Jquery version detected in metal-all.js for some customers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After adding work log and checking the work log details of the issue view, the timezone of the entries is in Sydney format (GMT+10)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have log work enabled as mentioned on https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/log-time-on-an-issue/
# Log work on a ticket
# Check the work log details

h3. Expected Results

The timezone of the Work log should match the users' profile timezone configuration.

h3. Actual Results

The timezone is displayed in Sydney format (GMT+10).

 !Work log.png|thumbnail! 

 !Work log 2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Check the same entry but at the issue history, it'll display with the proper timezone.
fields.summary: Work log displays the timezone in Sydney format (GMT+10)

fields.description:
I want to create tables from markup as an old issue view.
This possibility are described [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=tables]
fields.summary: Tables markup in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Quick search does not show results based on issue key for as you type feature. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1: In quick search box, start typing the issue key. 
 # Step 2: The results will have NO Results found entries.

h3. Expected Results

The issue appears on as per the search.
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Quick search with Issue key does not work on business projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
At present, the notification helper (part of the admin helper plugin) doesn't take 'Component Lead' into account. So if a notification should be sent to the component lead then the user will not realise this. Could we please add 'Component Lead' to the notification helper?

h4. Steps to Reproduce:
# Configure SAMPLE project with a component named component:
!component.png|thumbnail!
# Configure a notification with all component lead set to all events
!notification_scheme.png|thumbnail!
# Create an issue with the component(eg. SAMPLE-232):
!issue_component.png|thumbnail!


h3. Expected Result:

Notification Helper should show that user admin receive notification for any event for that issue. 

h3. Actual Result:
Notification show that user cannot receive any notification for that issue:
!notification_helper.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

There is currently no workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: The notification helper does not account for notifications being sent to 'Component Lead'

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Components aren't fully displayed when the text is too long. 

The users are not able to see the whole name either by clicking and activating the field or by hovering on the component. The only workaround at the moment is by clicking the component and opening the JQL filter which shows the whole text in the search bar.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a component with a long name to an issue.
 # See how the component name gets truncated.
 # Hovering over the truncated name does not show the full name of the component 

h3. Expected Results

Hovering over the truncated name should display the full name of the component. 
h3. Actual Results

Hovering over the truncated name does not display the full name of the component. 
h3. Workaround

The only workaround at this point is to click on the component to open the JQL filter to show the name of the component. 
h3. Screenshots

 
 * !Screenshot 2021-04-05 at 2.21.33 PM.png|thumbnail!   (Components with long names in old issue view)
 * !Screenshot 2021-04-05 at 2.19.37 PM.png|thumbnail! (Components with long names in new issue view -inline edit/add)
 * !Screenshot 2021-04-05 at 2.19.25 PM.png|thumbnail! (Components with long names in new issue view)
fields.summary: Long component names get truncated in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The due date field shows different translations when Jira is set to Spanish.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On Personal Settings, change the language to "Spanish"
 # Go to the search results and add the column "Due date"
 # Move the cursor over "Fecha de Entrega"

!image-2021-03-31-14-32-51-924.png|width=475,height=123!
h3. Expected Results

Both field names should be the same: "Fecha de vencimento"
h3. Actual Results

The column shows "Fecha de Entrega" and the alt text box shows "Fecha de vencimento", causing confusion.

h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Due date field shows different translations when Jira is set to Spanish.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The validator that validates whether an issue went through a specific status or not isn't displaying status options when creating or editing it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a validator in any transition of a workflow of type *Previous State Validator*
 
h3. Expected Results
Validator should allow users to select the status they wish to validate.

h3. Actual Results
Validator doesn't allow users to select the status they wish to validate.

h3. Workaround
# Create an automation rule with one condition for each available status in the workflow. 
# Each time an issue transitions to a specific status, the rule is triggered
# Each time the rule is triggered, it will add a distinct label to the issue depending on the status it went to
# This needs to be done to the issue creation as well
# Then add a validator based on field value using the labels to validate it
fields.summary: Previous State Validator	doesn't display options of status to select

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Broken Issue actions in the cog menu of the filter results gadget or similar that displays issues
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Dashboard
 # Add a gadget the will display issues like *Filter Results*
 # From the displayed results in the gadget select any issue and the cog options (...) and choose any of these options: Assign, Assign to me, Comment, Log Work, Attach files, Stop watching, Link, Clone, Labels or Add a field

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Should execute the action selected
h3. Actual Results
Does not perform any action

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Broken Issue actions in the cog menu of the filter results gadget or similar that displays issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Can’t search or switch between boards using the mobile app
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the Jira Cloud mobile app.
 # Open a Board.
 # Click on the board name on the top to either select another board you have permission to access or to search for a Board.

h3. Expected Results

It will show a list of the boards or results for your search.
h3. Actual Results

It shows “No results”.

!Image 2021-04-02 at 14.41.16.jpeg|width=294,height=653!
h3. Workaround


 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Can’t search or switch between boards using the mobile app

fields.description: When you are editing a field you need to click on save to apply the changes, if you don't click on save and close the browser the data is lost, it would be helpful if Jira pops up a confirmation window warning about data not saved.
fields.summary: Add a confirmation dialog display when closing the browser

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

System > Issues sidebar disappears when translating Statuses, Resolutions, and Priorities.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Cog icon > Issues > Statuses.
 # Click on “Translate statuses”.
 # Select the desired language and click on “View”.

h3. Expected Results

It will show the columns for each language and the left sidebar is visible in case you need to select another option. 
h3. Actual Results

The sidebar disappears and it only appears again if you click on “Update” after adding the translations or clicking on “Go back” on the browser.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Sidebar disappears when translating Statuses, Resolutions, and Priorities.

fields.description:
I had someone on my team working to create a dashboard from a filter-set that he configured from Advanced Roadmaps. 

It would be amazing to be able to create the underlying JQL for a filtered range from Advanced Roadmaps so that this can be used to create other views (eg a dashboard). 

The likely place where this would appear in a screenshot: 

!image-2021-04-02-10-13-23-503.png!

Adding the Dashboards & Gadgets component since there does not appear to be a component for Advanced Roadmaps :(
fields.summary: Jira Advanced Roadmaps - Ability to create JQL from Filter Set

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As per the following Jira cloud documentation: [Configure sub tasks|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/configure-sub-tasks] (section: How to choose which sub-task fields display on parent issues), it is suggested to include the constant field values for the property key "jira.table.cols.subtasks" as per the reference document: [constant values|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/7.6.1/index.html?constant-values.html]

However, in the Jira new issue view experience, modifying the field values for the property key "jira.table.cols.subtasks", does not have any effect. The following fields are displayed by default in the subtask view of the parent issue and any modifications to the setting don't reflect:
 * Summary
 * Assignee
 * Progress
 * Status
 * Issue type

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Advanced settings:
 https://<instance name>/secure/admin/AdvancedApplicationProperties.jspa
 # Make changes to jira.table.cols.subtasks by adding more fields or removing some fields.

h3. Expected Results

The Subtask should show only the added fields configured in Advanced Settings as mentioned in the documentation: [Configure sub tasks|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/configure-sub-tasks/]
h3. Actual Results

The Subtask doesn't show the added fields and continues to show the default fields configured viz.
 * Summary
 * Assignee
 * Progress
 * Status
 * Issue type

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Updating "jira.table.cols.subtasks" in Advanced Settings has no effect in the Jira new issue view experience

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Epic status is not visible on the new Issueview of the Epic issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Add Epic Status to the Screen(View/edit) for Epics in a project.
 2. Create an Epic
 3. View the epic in the new issue view 
h3. Expected Results

1. The Epic Status field is visible and editable.
h3. Actual Results

1. The Epic Status field is not visible in the view screen on the new issue view.
h3. Workaround
h4.  

No workaround is present at the moment.
fields.summary: Adding Epic status to Issue screen(view/Eidt) does not make it appear on new issue view

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like that when filtering the issues inside the project the option to clear the selection to be moved below to the options.
 !image-2021-04-02-09-00-00-938.png|thumbnail! 
As per the example above, when there is no selection, the option Clear All is not displayed, as soon as you select an option, it shifts all the options down and could cause some misclicks while attempting to select other options.

It would be good if the option Clear All could be shifted below to the options or a space for it should already be reserved to avoid shifting the options at the dropdown list.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like that when filtering the issues inside the project the option to clear the selection to be moved below to the options

fields.description: The Cloud sandbox functions allow copying the data from production, but having real data in our sandbox may be inconvenient, and a security concern, especially when working with multiple clients, and it would be great if it was possible to randomly generate data to populate the sandbox rather than having the real data.
fields.summary: Provide features to generate sample / randomized data in our Sandbox

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In its current state, the top [+navigation+|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/new-jira-cloud-navigation/] bar is not customizable where you could hide apps or re-order where they are displayed.

Not every app on this bar is used by all teams and as we continue to add more integrations, more apps or tabs will get added (Plans, Insight, ect...).

 !image__5_.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Proposed solution

* Add a manage apps settings where you can select what tabs or apps you want to show or hide
* Add a manage apps settings where you can drag and drop where you would like each tab or app to be displayed and change the order
fields.summary: Customizable navigation bar

fields.description:
Hi,

Currently there is no Bulgarian Language Pack available in Jira Cloud.

Also there is no Translation Add-On for Jira Cloud.

Can you include some of this features in yours roadmap.
fields.summary: Bulgarian Language Pack for Jira Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As per the [Archive project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/archive-a-project-1013843066.html] page, the project admin would be able to archive the project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 NA

h3. Expected Results
NA

h3. Actual Results

The document should explicitly mention the feature permission requirement as below:
* For classic projects - only Global Admins should be able to Archive and Move to Trash.
* For Next-Gen Projects - Global Admin + Project Admin should be able to archive and move to trash.

h3. Workaround

NA
fields.summary: Documentation bug for project archive feature.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the issue view, the Automation side bar is not a full height in the Firefox browser. The issue is specific to Firefox.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an automation rule in a project
# In the Firefox browser, open an issue in the above project and navigate to *Automation > Rule extensions*
# The issue sidebar doesn't show in full height

h3. Expected Results
Automation issue sidebar should be of full height

h3. Actual Results
Issue sidebar is not in full height in Firefox browser

h3. Workaround
The workaround is to use any other browser
fields.summary: Automation issue sidebar is not full height in the Firefox browser

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an issue contains a video file in its description field, the attached video is automatically download when listed on the advanced search view (List View).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue and attach a video on its description field
 # Perform an advanced search to list this issue and visualize it in List View including the description field.

h3. Expected Results
Fields listed

h3. Actual Results
Fields listed and videos from the description field are automatically downloaded

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Performing advanced search using List View automatically downloads video file attached on description field
Setting a single select field to "none" for a dynamic field in a Connect App does not change the data

fields.description:
*Atlasisan Update on April 28, 2021*

*Hi All, thanks for the feedback. want to share an interim update that we're working on bringing back the old issue behaviour for comment section, which will always show the newest 5 comments and hide the oldest comment. Apology for the frustration this is causing we are looking to bring this to you in the next few weeks!*

 

 

In the old issue view when you see comments from oldest to newest Jira hides the old comments giving the option to show them if it is needed.
 [Picture example for the old issue view|https://share.getcloudapp.com/YEuRKLg0]

In the new issue view, the comments that are hidden are the newest ones.
 [Picture example for the new issue view|https://share.getcloudapp.com/YEuRKLkY]

This could cause confusion on how to track the comments correctly, it would be very helpful if the feature could work similarly to what we had in the old issue view.
fields.summary: New-issue view comments hide the newest comments instead of the oldest, the opposite as the old issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

At the moment, the Jira editor supports about 100 domain URLs that are auto-converted to smart link view:

!smartlinks.gif|width=505,height=165!
h3. Suggestion

Add more URLs to the list of supported domain names to ensure consistent behaviour.
fields.summary: Add more domain names for smart link feature in the Jira editor

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
The name of the transitions is not displayed on the issue view if only all is available:
!Screenshot 2021-03-31 at 18.00.17.png|thumbnail!
!Screenshot 2021-03-31 at 17.55.36.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Suggested Solution
Display the name of the transition when only "all" option is being used.
fields.summary: Display transition name when only "All" is available

fields.description: When hovering over the name of a user in Jira Cloud, it shows a window with the avatar and the name of the user, but the name will be cut out if they have more than 20 characters. The suggestion is to make the text automatically resize to fit always in the window.
fields.summary: Improve the user pop up to contain the entire name of the user

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The "Log Work" field is using the JIRA System "Default user time zone" to set the "Date Started". The field should pick the time as per the "User Time zone" set in the Profile section

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Verify the current timezone in the instance from System->General Configuration->Default user time zone. 
 # Update time zone in your [profile|https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences] to any other timezone.
 !Profile.png|thumbnail! 
# Add the "Log work" field in the resolution screen.
# On the resolution screen click on "Log Work" and check the "Date Started" field.
 !Resolution Screen.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The Time should default to the timezone set in the user profile.

h3. Actual Results

The Time is shown as per the JIRA "Default user time zone".


h3. Workaround

* You could enter the start time as per the "Default time zone".
* The Worklog audit would show the time as per the user profile.
 !Worklog.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Log Work in the resolution screen does not honour timezone of User's profile

fields.description:
In respect to the [Branching actions|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/work-with-related-issues/] and multi project scope rules, Automation for Jira employs JQL clause -- which looks like "{{project in 111,222,333}}" to iterate over the branched issues.

If one of these projects is trashed/deleted, the JQL returns an error, which is fed to Automation which then errors out the rule.
 !image-2021-03-31-14-50-25-426.png|thumbnail! 

If any of the projects get archived, deleted, or trashed the rules fail for all other projects in the scope. Automation for Jira should be able to handle removed projects instead of returning an error for the rule execution.

Manual intervention is now required to remove the deleted project from the rule as well.
fields.summary: Automatically remove project references from rule scope when project is deleted/archived

fields.description:
Please see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-16300 and https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-4669 

We are after this functionality in Kanban boards for Jira Cloud.  We use initiatives to group related Epics together.

We note we can see the initiative-epic relationship in advanced roadmaps, however use a Kanban board to display epics needing high-level requirements and elaboration.  As we have more than a few initiatives, the current process of creating a query each time is tedious.
fields.summary: Support for initiatives in kanban board swimlanes

fields.description: Separate download of Jira data and Jira media as for a restore, you most likely will have to first unzip and re-zip the export into two different files.
fields.summary: Option to split the Jira Cloud export file into data and media

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Clicking Add on Add Validator to Transition without selecting a validator results in 500 error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a workflow
 # On a transition, click Validators
 # Add validator
 # When presented with a list of validators to add, don't select anything and just click Add

h3. Expected Results

Do not allow user to click Add without first selecting a validator to add.
h3. Actual Results

500 error is shown:
{noformat}
Something went wrong
Try reloading the page, then check our Statuspage for any current outages. If there are no relevant outages, create a support request so we can help you out.
If you create a request, include the following so we can help you as fast as possible:
Error type: 500 - Internal server error
Log reference: [REDACTED]
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

If you are presented with the 500 error, click Back in the browser. Then when you are at Step 4 above, select a validator e.g. Parent Status Validator, then click Add.
fields.summary: Clicking Add on Add Validator to Transition without selecting a validator results in 500 error

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The triggers for scheduled Jobs using Automation use Cron expressions
Currently, these expressions can only be used in UTC timezonne.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be nice if the cron jobs follow the timezone specified in Jira instance.

h3. Workaround 
To convert the required time (for scheduling) to UTC and then create the cron expression
fields.summary: Ability to set the timezone for scheduled triggers

fields.description:
It is not possible to view the Linked issues as clickable hyperlinks in the current issue view for Jira issues. 

It would be helpful to introduce such a feature, so that a user is able to click the linked issue from the issue history directly, in order to help the user experience.
fields.summary: Enable linked issues' hyperlink in the issue history

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When opening an issue in the same tab from a filter's results, there are some problems:
 * The top bar will not follow your scroll, that is, the header with issue related information will not follow when you scroll down;
 * There will be an additional scroll bar on the right;
 ** Like if a third panel was added to the view.

Also, the scrollbar appearance on different is not consistent across the different OS. The scrollbar on the new Jira issue view varies with different OS platforms. While in mac it appears when we start scrolling the page and disappear when no activity on the page. In Windows, there are 4 scrollbars that are always visible and this gives an unpleasant look in the UI.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Access a saved filter to return results in the issue search navigation.

Either of the below also results in having 4 scroll bars on the UI
* Open any issue key on the Windows Platform
* Or, add an external mouse in mac the number of scrolls will always be 4


h3. Expected Results

The header of the issue will follow when you scroll down. No additional scroll bar should be put between the right side panel and the additional space created by collapsing the left sidebar.
h3. Actual Results

The header will not follow your scroll, and an additional scroll bar will be displayed in the screen on the top right, dividing the right side of the screen in two panels.

See the recording: [^Open issue from filter - New issue view.mp4]

h3. Update:

The problem with the scrollbars occur when you see an issue in the search navigation while in *Detail View* mode as well:
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-23 at 14.08.42.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Open the issue in a new tab instead of the same one. That will prevent those behaviour from occurring.
fields.summary: Problems with scrollbar when opening an issue from a filter's results in the new view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The project admins on the customer site are unable to archive a classic project.

The UI shows the option, but the backend returns an error response when the operation is attempted.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Create a new project.
 * Add a user as Project admin and grant the "browse project" permission.
 * The username should not have Jira admin access.

h3. Actual Results

When the goes to: *"Go to Projects -> All projects"*, the user is able to see the Options to *1. Archive 2. Move to Trash*, under the *"..."* menu . And when Archive (or Move to Trash) is clicked and confirmed the Archive fails with an error message.
h3. Expected Results

User should not see the options based on the following decision flow:
 * For classic projects - only Global Admins should be able to Archive and Move to Trash.
 * For Next-Gen Projexts - Global Admin + Project Admin should be able to archive and move to trash.

h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Project admins can't archive classic projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Clicking on "Log work" or "Comment" on a jira issue from the filter statistics gadget in the new dashboard UI does not return any action.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the new dashboard UI, create a filter statistics gadget and choose a filter
 # Save the gadget
 # From an issue displayed in the gadget, try to "Log work" or "Comment"

_*Issue in the gadget > ... > Log Work / Comment*_
h3. Expected Results

Users should be able to log work or comment on issues from the gadget as expected
h3. Actual Results

"Log work" and "Comment" options are unresponsive and do not return any action
h3. Workaround

The users can "Right click" and open the link in the new tab for log work/comment from the gadget
fields.summary: Unable to log work & comment on jira issues from the filter results gadget in the Jira dashboard (new UI)

fields.description:
*Summary* -

When we click on the View all starred option under the project menu, the arrow icon gives the impression that a new tab with all starred projects will show up however that doesn't work and a list of all projects is displayed.

*Steps to reproduce* -
 * Star mark projects in Jira site
 * Click on the *project* icon on the top which will display a list of projects
 * Click on the View all starred option in the menu

*Expected behavior -* 

A new tab should open that should display a list of all-star marked projects

*Current behaviour -*

 ** A list of all projects will show up
fields.summary: "View all starred" option under Project menu doesn't work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Cloning an issue that has got attachments without selecting clone attachments creates unreadable attachments in the cloned issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Clone an issue has got multiple attachments
 # Don't select the Clone attachments checkbox
 # Create
 # Refresh
 # Examine the cloned ticket

h3. Expected Results

No attachments in the cloned issue
h3. Actual Results

Unreadable attachments in the issue that cant be loaded

No attachments found in the backend database
h3. Workaround

Manually delete the corrupted files so the users don't get confused.
fields.summary: Cloning an issue that has got attachments without selecting clone attachments creates unreadable attachments in the cloned issue.

fields.description:
We frequently work with contractors outside of our organization who need to be assigned issues in a Jira project.  These contractors typically don't have a Jira license.

A project manager within our organization would be updating the issues as these contractors report status in meetings, and the contractors never really need to go into Jira to do anything.  However, Jira does not provide a good way to allow issues to be assigned.
  It would be great if you could allow manual creation of a non-licensed account similar to 
how SmartSheet does it by allowing you to create a guest account with First Name, Last Name, and email address.  Then limit these accounts to being assigned to tasks and viewing, or limited role.
fields.summary: Add the Ability to Create Non-Licensed Jira Accounts for Collaborators Outside Your Organization

fields.description:
h3. Description

In Jira Service Management requests, we have an option called "Hide details" where we can hide the fields that are filled in when the customer creates a request in service projects.

!Hide Details.png|width=939,height=100!

However, we don't have this option in other Jira issues (for software), even if the issue contains a large amount of information in the description.
h3. Suggestion

It would be great to have the "Hide details" option for all Jira issues.
fields.summary: Add the "Hide details" option for all Jira issues
Non-batched Notifications bypass Personal Settings notification options

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You can visualise a time tracking bar next to the Sub-tasks while in the parent view. That bar displays the progress of the relation between the *hour logged* and *remaining estimate*.

But currently when you hover over the bar, it will not show you the information in actual numbers like it should.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Create Sub-tasks under an issue;
* Set an original estimate to the Sub-tasks, and log hours on it.

h3. Expected Results

Besides visible progress in the time tracking bar, you should be able to see its values in number format when hovering over.

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens when you hover over the bar:
 !Screen Shot 2021-03-19 at 14.16.56.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

You can still see the actual values when accessing the Sub-task itself, or in the issue search navigation or gadgets.
fields.summary: Sub-task time tracking information not visible on parent view when hovering over its time tracking bar in the new view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating Automation Rules triggered by *SLA threshold breached* on a Project, the drop-down menu shows all SLAs of the instance to choose from. Only SLAs of said project should be presented.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Project Settings > Automation > Create an Automation Rule triggered by SLA Breach;
 # Click on the drop-down menu "Select an SLA..."

h3. Expected Results

Only SLAs of current Project should be presented.
h3. Actual Results

All SLAs of the instance are shown.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: SLA triggers should be divided by project on project-level automation rules

fields.description: As an Admin , it would be great we could export the list of custom fields available in the instance, along with their types, context , values, screens used etc.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to export all the custom fields from the instance

fields.description:
In Mac for the new issue view, for modal dialogs, "ctr-return" is used to submit the comments. However, in the issue view screen, we have to use "cmd-return" instead to submit the comments. 

Hence this creates confusion as different shortcut keys are being used to submit the comments in the new issue view. 

It would be better to have a single shortcut key for submitting the comments in the new issue view.
fields.summary: Shortcut keys for the new issue view.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When users are clicking on the *3 dots*> *Assign* under the *Assigned to me* dashboard gadget, nothing happens.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure an *Assigned to me* gadget on a dashboard.
 # Click on *3 dots* for a Issue present in the gadget > Assign

h3. Expected Results
When I click “Assign”, I should get a screen to assign the issue to someone else

h3. Actual Results
On clicking “Assign”, nothing is happening.

h3. Workaround
Explicitly open the issue and assign.
fields.summary: Assign items in the ellipsis dropdown in AssignedToMe gadget not working

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, when user preview excel attachment , it will separate the excel sheet table into two pages if the sheets have more than 3 columns. Depending on the size. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be best to combine all columns in one page. 

h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Combine excel sheet table in one page when using attachment preview

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Activity stream gadget does not work if the language in personal settings set to Korean
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set personal settings to Korean on Korean OS
 # Add Activity Stream gadget 

h3. Expected Results

To load the activity stream gadget
h3. Actual Results

It keeps on loading.
h3. Workaround
 * Go to personal settings and change the language to English. 
 * Configure the gadget in English and Save
 * Change the personal setting back to Korean
fields.summary: Activity stream gadget does not work if the language in personal settings set to Korean

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary We have received 403 Forbidden response codes and an HTML formatted message from Jira Cloud API for called to both GET `/rest/api/3/issue//changelog` and PUT `/rest/api/3/`. We acknowledge that we know about the rate limiting changes taking place currently, and believe the cause of the this issue could be due to database overloading. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Attempt to perform a GET `/rest/api/3/issue//changelog` # Receive the following error: Response was 403 with: {noformat} Forbidden (403)

Forbidden (403)

Encountered a "403 - Forbidden" error while loading this page.

Go to Jira home

{noformat} h3.  Expected Results If this is caused by potential database overloading, a response message containing more clarity can be issued. h3. Actual Results Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Calls to Jira Cloud cause 403 Forbidden response
Changing the field permission caused PUT payloads to Jira API to fail with 400

fields.description:
Hi Jira Team,

Can we please get a feature request raised (if not already) to get the AWS and Azure Integrations for Jira Cloud asap!

This would be a massive bonus to the cloud product.

[https://documentation.mindville.com/insight-aws-integration/latest]

[https://documentation.mindville.com/insight-azure-integration/latest]
fields.summary: Extend Insight Integrations for AWS / Azure to Jira Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If there's a story in a specific column of a Kanban board with sub-tasks, when the subtask is moved to another column user will not be able to rank it higher or lower by dragging it. But users can still change the rank by moving the stories above and below the sub-task.
h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to drag the sub-task to change the rank in a column
h3. Actual Results

The user is not able to change the rank because the subtask can't be moved.
h3. Workaround

Move the stories above or below the sub-task to re-rank the sub-task.
fields.summary: Unable to rank sub-task higher than parent task in another column

fields.description:
{panel:title=Alt Text Editor }
 

Teams,

Since the implementation of the new editor into Jira and Confluence, we have been working to improve the experience.

Starting today, the alt-text editor is available in all instances of Jira including the new experience. As we begin deprecating the old editor, customers will be able to migrate and retain their alt-text capability.

Thank you for your patience with this issue,

Jonathan Thurston,
 Head of Accessibility

 
{panel}
 
h3. Issue Summary

The editor in the new issue view does not have any way of providing alt-text to the images impacting accessibility. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Scenario 1:
 ** You’re on the old editor, never migrated to new editor, never opened an issue in new editor:
 Your alt text is not changed, it’s in wiki markup,
 It’s stored in the the wiki markup editor, and recalled from the source
 It’s in the view for view-issue. (rendered)

 * Scenario 2:
 ** You added alt-text in the old editor, migrated to the new editor - but you haven’t edited any existing tickets/content that contains alt-text.
 Your alt text is still in the original wiki-markup editor, but it’s not recalled from the source
 The migration to new editor does not pull alt-text across
 It can’t be rendered as it doesn’t exist in the new editor
 You can migrate back to wiki markup editor and retain alt-text.

 * Scenario 3:
 ** You added alt-text in old editor, you migrated to the new editor prior to the update - you edit content on some issues on the new editor, and switch to the old editor
 Any ‘saved’ or ‘updated’ content from the new editor is lost on alt-text because it wrote the data using new editor (without alt-text support)
 Migrating to old editor makes available unchanged wiki markup issues, but no new content.
 Alt-text not created by the new editor (while it was not available) was not saved.

h3. Expected Results

The new issue view should have allowed a way to retain the alt-text. It should allow us a way to enter the alt-text to images to ensure accessibility.
h3. Actual Results

The editor allows the creation of alt-text, saves alt-text and displays alt-text as expected.
fields.summary: New issue view editor does not give any option to add alt-text against images

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the user tries to add a custom field to the issue search results it disappears if two custom fields with the same name exist in the instance but have different project contexts, unless the user has access to the projects applied on both custom fields contexts.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two custom fields with the *same name* and type.
 # Make the custom field A available only to a project X and the custom field B to a project Y. 
 # User must have access only to the context applied to one of the custom fields.
 # On the issue search results, look for the custom field created and add it.
 # Try to reorganize the added field, it'll disappear.

h3. Expected Results

User should get an error when trying to add a field in which they are not included in the context - or it's duplicated.
h3. Actual Results

The added field (column) will disappear:

!https://p81.f1.n0.cdn.getcloudapp.com/items/8Lub4yv0/135dfaa2-fd6c-420c-b0a4-cee419549fc9.gif?source=viewer&v=fef4530169bd131c7320aad43aa35bf0|width=451,height=412!
h3. Workaround

Renaming the affected custom field to a name that doesn't already exist fixes the issue.
fields.summary: Reordering columns on search results makes field disappear

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, We have the option to change the issue history using the below REST API but we would also like to be able to "DELETE" the issue history of the ticket.

REST API: [Get Change Logs|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issues/#api-rest-api-3-issue-issueidorkey-changelog-get]
h3. Expected Results

Would be very good to be able to *delete* the Issue history when required.
h3. Actual Results

Able to change the Issue History using the above mentioned REST API.
h3. Workaround

Currently the only option is to Clone the ticket so that the Issue history is not copied but it is not feasible when there are multiple tickets.
fields.summary: Purge issue history of Jira tickets using REST API

fields.description:
Currently, we can't hide the name of transition on the workflow view page only in next-gen project. This leads to lower visibility. 
It is good to show the transitions when the cursor is hovered over them just like in Classic project.
 !AtlassianSupport 2021-03-26 16.44.47.png|thumbnail!  !AtlassianSupport 2021-03-26 16.43.38.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to hide the name of transitions on the workflow view page in next-gen
